703720f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street
703720f-a.text:
194-222 Columbia Heights, west sidc, between Clark and Pierrepont Streets, showing in the background a side view of No. Pierrepont Street.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

703717f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street
703717f-a.text:
138-148 Columbia Heights, west side, between Clark and Pineapple Streets. The numbers in this view are from right to left. Maresi the Caterer,began business as such,(1888) at No. 80 Clinton Street, Brooklvn. He lived in the second house from the left. This house was erected for Isaac Henderson,Publisher of the Evening Post. In the next house once
lived John Freeland.collector of JInternal Revenue.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703717f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

703718f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street
703718f-a.text:
165 Columbia Heights, east side, between Clark and Pierrepont Streets.
April 4, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

703719f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street
703719f-a.text:
170-178 Columbia Heights, west side, south of Clark Street. The Shearman homestead, a land mark for the past century, was purchased by Carl Gottes. PVn, New York Investor, who plans to erect a modern apartment on site.
1934.
